title: DNA
summary: DNA (Deoxyribonucleic acid) carries genetic instructions for development and functioning of organisms; shaped like a double helix.
sample_question: What is the full form of DNA and what is its structure called?

title: The Cell
summary: The cell is the basic structural and functional unit of organisms. It can be prokaryotic (no nucleus) or eukaryotic (has nucleus).
sample_question: What is the main difference between a prokaryotic cell and a eukaryotic cell?

title: Nucleus
summary: The nucleus is a membrane-bound organelle containing chromosomes and controlling growth and reproduction in eukaryotic cells.
sample_question: Why is the nucleus often referred to as the 'control center' of the cell?

title: Cell Cycle
summary: The cell cycle is the series of events in growth and cell division: interphase (growth) and mitotic phase (division).
sample_question: In which phase of the cell cycle does the cell spend the most time?
